news.shortDetail: Scientist makes stunning confession as he claims life already found on Mars.
news.fullDetail: Dr Gilbert Levin, who worked on the Viking Mars landers in the 1970s, claims NASA had already answered the “ultimate question”, that is, that Mars supports alien life. Writing in a blog post for American Scientific, Dr Levin said the rover he worked on found biological formations that revealed the presence of microbial organisms.

comments.comment: This seems impossible given what we know about Mars.
Mars' landscape is said to have once inhabited life and oceans.
This is fake since there has been no sighting of life reported.
I work with NASA there have been no sign of life on mars.

news.fullDetail: A small tech startup has announced a charger that can fully charge a smartphone in just 10 seconds. Scientists are divided, some calling it a breakthrough while others demand proof of its safety and battery longevity.

news.topic: Thompson Beats Lyles in Olympic Final Rematch
news.shortDetail: Jamaican sprinter Kishane Thompson defeats Noah Lyles in a 100m race.
news.fullDetail: At the Silesia Diamond League meeting, Jamaican sprinter Kishane Thompson triumphed over Olympic champion Noah Lyles in a thrilling 100m rematch, clocking 9.87 seconds to Lyles' season-best 9.90.
